tldr: On September 16, 2025, markets remain buoyant ahead of the Federal Reserve’s widely anticipated 25 basis-point rate cut. The S&P 500 ETF (SPY) trades near record highs at $660.00, while volatility gauges remain subdued—VIX at ~15.18, VIXY at $33.58, and VIXM at $16.19—signaling investor confidence. Oklo (OKLO) closed at $95.83, up modestly intraday, buoyed by strong sector momentum and recent strategic partnerships. Rocket Lab (RKLB) trades at $48.13, supported by robust launch activity and bullish analyst sentiment. With macro tailwinds and positive company-specific developments, the tone is decidedly risk-on. For September 17, I expect continued upside in SPY (~+0.3%), modest gains in OKLO (~+2%), and steady performance in RKLB (~+1%), barring any surprises from the Fed or retail sales data.

macro_watch.event: VIX options expiration (Vix-piration) and triple witching
